poem:
### The Inheritocracy

A man struts across the morning page,  
wealth sticking like autumn leaves,  
never raked, just gathering,  
while we sip coffee and nod,  
admiring his windfall dance,   
a compass pointing north,   
draped in profits sifted  
from gardens never tilled,  
as others barter daylight  
for the price of bread.
